description: Also known as the Leadbeater's Cockatoo, this is arguably one of the most beautiful cockatoos, with soft white and salmon-pink plumage and a stunning, large crest of red and yellow bands.
temperament: Intelligent and active, but are not typically as cuddly as other cockatoo species. They are known to be more independent and can become quite aggressive, especially males.
loudness: Loud. They have a loud, quavering call that can be very piercing.
vocalization: Not known for being great talkers, but can learn a few words. Their natural call is very distinct.
dietaryNeeds: A formulated diet is best, supplemented with a variety of vegetables. In the wild, they eat a lot of seeds, but this should be limited in captivity to prevent obesity.
healthPointers: A hardy species with a lifespan of 60+ years. Can be prone to bonding with one person and becoming aggressive toward others.
housing: Not recommended for apartments. They need a very large cage or aviary to accommodate their active nature. Minimum 36"W x 24"D x 48"H.
